description: A historical novel follows the efforts of a group of Poles, led by a famous actress, to build a utopian commune in California in the 1870s.

When his wife and children are killed by a terrorist bomb in Dublin, a renegade Irish-American molecular biologist who calls himself the Madman unleashes a genetically carried plague that threatens all life on Earth. Reprint. 20,000 first printing.
A gunfighter with a shadowy past encounters a young woman being pressured into marriage with her foster father's wastrel son — until tragedy, fate, and the mysterious rider intervene.
A novel by Thomas Savage (Power of the Dog)
Hirsch writes a startling account of life on the streets. Wendy and Amanda both came from the suburbs, both had dreams of lasting love and security. But befoer age 30, both women were homeless.
A novel of ruthless street gangs, a young parolee's problems, and a disturbingly interested sponsor

In a post-nuclear war America controlled by Comus, the communications network/police force, double agent Howard Rohan is caught between the orders of Comus and the demands of revolutionaries determined to destroy America's totalitarian system

book_title: To a Friend: Sunny Thoughts for Monday Moods

description: "Trails Plowed Under" by Charles M Russell. Published by Good Press. Good Press publishes a wide range of titles that encompasses every genre. From well-known classics & literary fiction and non-fiction to forgotten−or yet undiscovered gems−of world literature, we issue the books that need to be read. Each Good Press edition has been meticulously edited and formatted to boost readability for all e-readers and devices. Our goal is to produce eBooks that are user-friendly and accessible to everyone in a high-quality digital format.
"Iris and Vivi work to uncover their dark, dangerous, and possibly magical past when their older sister Grey goes missing"--

When a terrorist attack at Washington's biggest airport leaves more than five hundred dead, Mack Bolan heads up a strike force that includes the warriors of Stony Man to take down an American militia group that has united with Jihad terrorists in an attempt to destroy the U.S. goverment. Original.

Finalist for the 2020 National Book Award for Fiction One of the New York Times' Ten Best Books of the Year Named one of the best novels of the year by Time, Washington Post, NPR, Chicago Tribune, Esquire, BBC, and many others National Bestseller "A blistering little classic." —Ron Charles, Washington Post A Children’s Bible follows a group of twelve eerily mature children on a forced vacation with their families at a sprawling lakeside mansion. Contemptuous of their parents, the children decide to run away when a destructive storm descends on the summer estate, embarking on a dangerous foray into the apocalyptic chaos outside. Lydia Millet’s prophetic and heartbreaking story of generational divide offers a haunting vision of what awaits us on the far side of Revelation.

book_title: The Case of California (Parallax: Re-visions of Culture and Society)
description: "[Rickels] is capable of juxtapositions that are both startling and brilliant."--Andreas Killen, The San Francisco Bay Guardian.

Mindstar Rising is the first in Peter F. Hamilton's hugely popular Greg Mandel series. It's the 21st century and global warming is here to stay, so forget the way your country used to look. And get used to the free market, too - the companies possess all the best hardware, and they're calling the shots now. In a world like this, a man open to any offers can do just fine. A man like Greg Mandel for instance, who's psi-boosted, wired into the latest sensory equipment and carrying state-of-the-art weaponry. He's also been part of the English Army's Mindstar Battalion. As the cartels battle for control of a revolutionary new power source, and corporate greed outstrips national security, tension is mounting to boiling point. And Greg Mandel is about to face the ultimate test. Mindstar Rising is followed by A Quantum Murder and The Nano Flower to complete the Greg Mandel trilogy.

book_title: View of Dawn in the Tropics, a Novel
